snippet: Fresh accusations about the veracity of the works come as the venerable Upper East Side gallery Knoedler & Company battles accusations that it sold pieces of modern art that were actually sophisticated forgeries.
abstract: Knoedler & Company, a now-defunct venerable Upper East Side art gallery rocked by several art forgery lawsuits, battles new accusations from the family of abstract painter Richard Diebenkorn; family members claim that the gallery sold several disputed drawings of his even after the relatives voiced concerns in 1993 that the works were not authentic.
lead_paragraph: Fresh accusations about the veracity of the works come as the venerable Upper East Side gallery Knoedler & Company battles accusations that it sold pieces of modern art that were actually sophisticated forgeries.

headline.seo: Diebenkorn Family Says It Warned Knoedler on Drawings
headline.main: Artist’s Family Says Gallery Ignored Warning of Fakes
headline.print_headline: Artist’s Family Says Gallery Ignored Warning of Fakes
